register.reg_long_name: Performance Monitors Common Event Identification register 3
register.reg_condition: when AArch32 is supported at any Exception level and ARMv8.1-PMU is implemented

purpose_text.para: Defines which common architectural events and common microarchitectural events are implemented, or counted, using PMU events in the range 0x4020 to 0x403F.
When the value of a bit in the register is 1 the corresponding common event is implemented and counted.

note.para: Arm recommends that, if a common event is never counted, the value of the corresponding register bit is 0.

purpose_text.para: For more information about the common events and the use of the PMCEIDn registers see .

field_description.para: IDhi[n] corresponds to common event (0x4020 + n).

field_value_description.para: The common event is not implemented, or not counted.

field_description.para: A bit that corresponds to a reserved event number is reserved. The value might be used in a future revision of the architecture to identify an additional common event.

note.para: Such an event might be added retrospectively to an earlier version of the PMU architecture, provided the event does not require any additional PMU features and has an event number that can be represented in the PMCEID<n> registers of that earlier version of the PMU architecture.

ps.name: MRC
